(Vampire, True) Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

(Vampire, True) Mist Escape.name: (Vampire, True) Mist Escape
(Vampire, True) Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

(Vampire, True) Turn to Mist.name: (Vampire, True) Turn to Mist
(Vampire, True) Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Gaseous Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Drain Thoug.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Drain Thoughts
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Drain Thoug.description:
Requirements A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vetalarana's reach

Effect The vetalarana seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, and the vetalarana regains HP equal to 10% of the vetalarana's maximum HP, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that is already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to the vetalarana but increases the victim's stupefied value by 1. Additionally, the vetalarana views one of the victim's memories.

A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim that becomes stupefied 5 in this way is rendered comatose, becoming permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. As long as the vetalarana lives, a comatose victim can't regain consciousness, and its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Mental Rebi.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Mental Rebirth
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Mental Rebi.description:
Unlike most other undead, a vetalarana isn't destroyed when they reach 0 HP. Instead, their body is destroyed, crumbling to ash, and their mind is immediately transferred into a creature they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts. This creature must be within 1 mile; if no such creature is in range, the vetalarana is destroyed. The creature becomes controlled by the vetalarana and loses the stupefied and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions. If the creature controlled by a vetalarana in this way is killed, the vetalarana's mind transfers to another creature within 1 mile who they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts.

After [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} of being controlled, the controlled creature dies, and its body transforms into that of the vetalarana who rendered it comatose.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Thoughtsens.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Thoughtsense 100 feet
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Thoughtsens.description: The vetalarana senses all non-mindless creatures within 100 feet as a precise sense.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Vetalarana.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Vetalarana Vulnerabilities
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Basic) Vetalarana.description:
All vetalaranas possess the following weaknesses.

  • Barred Senses A vetalarana can't see or sense through force effects or cold iron, and their mind can't penetrate force effects or cold iron. Such barriers can prevent the transference of a vetalarana's mind through Mental Rebirth.
  • Revulsion A vetalarana delights in consuming memories and secrets, and is disgusted by those who share such sensitive tidbits openly. A vetalarana can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of a creature loudly voicing their intimate personal secrets or most cherished memories aloud. Speaking such information aloud with conviction is a single action that has the auditory, concentrate, and linguistic traits, and protects the creature until the start of its next turn. A vetalarana that involuntarily comes within 10 feet of a creature sharing such information gains the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition until they're 10 feet or farther from the creature. After 1 round of being exposed to the secrets of a creature, a vetalarana can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/r 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Vulnerable to Brain Destruction A vetalarana whose brain has been destroyed, or is reduced to 0 HP while unable to take mental actions, can't use Mental Rebirth.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Contr.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Control Comatose
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Contr.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The vetalarana manipulator spends 10 minutes to take psychic control of the creatures they've rendered comatose with Drain Thoughts. This has the effects of the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, but lasts for up to 6 hours, has a range of 1 mile, and the vetalarana can control a number of comatose victims at a time equal to half the vetalarana's level. A comatose victim can't resist this possession and automatically gets a critical failure on its saving throw against Control Comatose.

As long as a comatose victim is controlled by a vetalarana manipulator in this way, the victim's stupefied and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions are temporarily suppressed.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Drain.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Drain Thoughts
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Drain.description:
Requirements A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vetalarana's reach

Effect The vetalarana seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} {@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical success), and the vetalarana regains HP equal to 10% of the vetalarana's maximum HP, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that is already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to the vetalarana but increases the victim's stupefied value by 1. Additionally, the vetalarana views one of the victim's memories. The vetalarana manipulator can choose to alter, enhance, or erase the memory they view as a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Modify Memory} spell.

A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim that becomes stupefied 5 in this way is rendered comatose, becoming permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. As long as the vetalarana lives, a comatose victim can't regain consciousness, and its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

(Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Paral.name: (Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Paralyzing Claws
(Vampire, Vetalarana, Manipulator) Paral.description: Any living creature hit by a vetalarana manipulator's claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. The target can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the effect, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save. Use the moderate DC for the creature's level.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Bubonic Pla.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Bubonic Plague
(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Bubonic Pla.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Bubonic Plague|traits:disease] (use a high DC for the vrykolakas's level)

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] every [[/br {1d20} #minutes]]{1d20 minutes} (1 day)

(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Change Shap.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Change Shape
(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Change Shap.description: A vrykolakas master can transform into a form resembling the body it had in life, with the effects of humanoid form but with unlimited duration. It loses its fangs and claw Strikes but gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} in this form.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Children of.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Children of the Night
(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Children of.description:
The presence of a vrykolakas master inspires savage creatures to crawl forth to do its bidding, including @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Sft7n3LMmnTxhhYn]{Wargs}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.bLMoqt9xqTZKnjxr]{Werewolves}, and similar creatures.

The vrykolakas master can give telepathic orders to these creatures within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Create Spaw.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Create Spawn
(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Create Spaw.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, a vrykolakas master can turn this creature into a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.8IyfadYYpYXBvlXN]{Vrykolakas Spawn} by donating some of its own blood to the creature and burying it in earth for 3 nights.

Such vrykolakas spawn are generally friendly to the vrykolakas that created them, but they are not under its control and typically wander off on their own rampage within [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} of their creation.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Dominate An.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Dominate Animal
(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Dominate An.description:
The vrykolakas can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell that affects only animals. The save DC is a high DC for the vrykolakas's level, and a creature that succeeds is immune to that vrykolakas's Dominate Animal for 24 hours. Destroying the vrykolakas ends the effect, but reducing it to 0 HP does not.

A dominated animal takes a -4 circumstance penalty to saving throws against the vrykolakas's Feral Possession.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Pestilentia.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Pestilential Aura
(Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Pestilentia.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures beginning their turn in the area while the vrykolakas is in its true form are exposed to bubonic plague.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Drink Blood.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Drink Blood
(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Drink Blood.description:
Requirements The vrykolakas' last action was a successful fangs Strike

Effect The vrykolakas sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} if a vrykolakas master uses this action), and the vrykolakas regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire, but it increases the creature's drained condition value by 1. A vrykolakas can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

The target creature's drained condition value decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a successful @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drained value by 1 after 10 minutes.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Feral Possession.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Feral Possession
(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Feral Possession.description:
Trigger The vrykolakas is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and an animal is within 100 feet

Effect Unlike most other undead, a vrykolakas isn't destroyed when it reaches 0 HP. Instead, it attempts to cast its spirit into an animal within 100 feet, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:|name:Feral Possession] save (use a high DC for the vrykolakas's level).

On a failure, the animal is possessed. This has the effects of the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, but it lasts a number of days equal to the vrykolakas's level. This possession can't be counteracted with magic (though @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OyFCwQuw8XRazsNr]{Remove Curse} works against it normally).

If the animal succeeds at its save, the vrykolakas can attempt to possess a different animal within 100 feet. If at any point an animal critically succeeds at its save or no animal is within 100 feet, the vrykolakas fails to possess anything and is destroyed.

A vrykolakas possessing an animal seeks out its burial site immediately, burying itself there. While the vrykolakas is in this state of recovery, its animal host is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, and beheading it destroys the vrykolakas and kills its host. Removing the curse destroys the vrykolakas and returns the animal to normal.

After [[/br 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}, if the vrykolakas hasn't been destroyed, the animal dies and the vrykolakas rises in a new body that's identical to its previous one, formed from the animal's remains.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Swift Tracker.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Swift Tracker
(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Swift Tracker.description: The vrykolakas moves at full Speed while @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracking}.

(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Vrykolakas Vulnera.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Vrykolakas Vulnerabilities
(Vampire, Vrykolakas) Vrykolakas Vulnera.description:
Vrykolakas all have the following vulnerabilities.

  • Burial Site Bound A vrykolakas is bound to the place of its death or interment. It must return to this location once per week and bury itself in the earth for 24 hours, during which time it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} and can be beheaded. If it is unable to return to this site, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points and attempts to use Feral Corruption; if this host animal can't return to the burial site before the possession effect ends, the vrykolakas is destroyed and the animal host returns to normal.
  • Vulnerable to Decapitation A vrykolakas that is beheaded can't use its Feral Possession, and a beheaded corpse cannot rise as a vrykolakas.

(Visitant) Noxious Breath.name: (Visitant) Noxious Breath
(Visitant) Noxious Breath.description:
The visitant exhales sharply, releasing pungent fumes from its lungs in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]{15-foot cone}.

Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Noxious Breath] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

(Visitant) Roar.name: (Visitant) Roar
(Visitant) Roar.description:
The visitant lets out a loud and horrifying roar. Each creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} must attempt at a @Check[type:will|dc:|name:Roar] save.

No matter the result, affected creatures are then temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

(Visitant) Vengeful Presence.name: (Visitant) Vengeful Presence
(Visitant) Vengeful Presence.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that starts its turn within the visitant's aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:|name:Vengeful Presence] save or be overcome with a thirst for vengeance.

For [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (1 minute on a critical failure), if the affected creature was attacked within the last round (whether or not the attack hit), the creature must use at least 1 action per round to Strike or use a hostile action toward its last attacker as long as the attacker is still alive. Failure to do so deals the affected creature [[/r {1d6}[mental]]]{1d6 mental damage}, plus 1d6 for every 5 levels the visitant has.

(Visitant) Visitant Spells.name: (Visitant) Visitant Spells
(Visitant) Visitant Spells.description:
Some visitants can cast the following innate occult spells. If you give a visitant the following spells, consider removing one of its other special abilities.

Occult Innate Spells

DC varies

Spell Attack varies

1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

Constant (1st) @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.QnTtGCAvdWRU4spv]{Detect Alignment (evil only)}

(Visitant) Wrestle.name: (Visitant) Wrestle
(Visitant) Wrestle.description: The visitant makes a claw Strike against a creature it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

(Werecreature) Animal Empathy.name: (Werecreature) Animal Empathy
(Werecreature) Animal Empathy.description: A werecreature can communicate with animals of the same general kind.

(Werecreature) Change Shape.name: (Werecreature) Change Shape
(Werecreature) Change Shape.description:
The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

(Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature.name: (Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature
(Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Curse of the Werecreature] DC is the standard DC for the werecreature's new level -1.

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

(Werecreature) Moon Frenzy.name: (Werecreature) Moon Frenzy
(Werecreature) Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike (or a similar Strike) by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

(Worm That Walks) Discorporate.name: (Worm That Walks) Discorporate
(Worm That Walks) Discorporate.description:
When the worm that walks is reduced to 0 HP, it discorporates and the component worms that make up its body disperse in every direction. If even a single worm escapes, the worm that walks will eventually re-form using a process that typically takes [[/r 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}.

While the exact circumstances and surroundings determine how long the worm that walks's foes have to dispatch the fleeing worms before they escape, usually its foes have only a single round.

Typically, this requires the application of an area effect or splash weapon within 1 round to the space where the worm that walks collapsed. After any amount of area or splash damage is dealt to that space, the character dealing the damage must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15|showDC:owner] check. Each subsequent area or splash damage effect performed on the area reduces the DC of this flat check by 2, to a minimum of DC 5. If any of these flat checks succeed, none of the worms escape, and the worm that walks is destroyed permanently.

At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or otherwise detaining the vermin may extend the time allowed to finish off the worm that walks.

(Worm That Walks) Squirming Embrace.name: (Worm That Walks) Squirming Embrace
(Worm That Walks) Squirming Embrace.description: The worm that walks Strides, ending its movement sharing a space with a creature, and deals piercing damage to the creature equal to [[/r {1d8}[piercing]]]{1d8 piercing} plus an additional 1d8 for every 3 levels the worm that walks has. The creature can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:|basic:true|name:Squirming Embrace] save with a DC of the worm that walks's spell DC - 2.

(Worm That Walks) Swarm Shape.name: (Worm That Walks) Swarm Shape
(Worm That Walks) Swarm Shape.description:
The worm that walks collapses into a shapeless swarm of worms. It drops all held, worn, and carried items.

While discorporated, the worm that walks can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but it can move through areas small enough for its individual worms to fit without having to Squeeze. It can use the same action to coalesce back into its normal form.

(Zombie, Shock) Arcing Strikes.name: (Zombie, Shock) Arcing Strikes
(Zombie, Shock) Arcing Strikes.description: When a shock zombie hits a creature with a melee attack, an arc of lighting leaps to a second creature, dealing [[/r {1d12}[electricity]]]{1d12 electricity damage}. This secondary target must be within 10 feet of the shock zombie's original target and must be the creature closest to the original target (if multiple creatures are equidistant, the shock zombie chooses which to affect).

(Zombie, Shock) Breath Weapon.name: (Zombie, Shock) Breath Weapon
(Zombie, Shock) Breath Weapon.description: The shock zombie breathes lightning, dealing [[/r {4d12}[electricity]]]{4d12 electricity damage} in a @Template[type:line|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true]). It can't use its Breath Weapon again for 1 minute.

(Zombie, Shock) Electromechanical Phasin.name: (Zombie, Shock) Electromechanical Phasing
(Zombie, Shock) Electromechanical Phasin.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shock zombie activates its electromechanical components and begins phasing in and out of reality. The shock zombie casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zR67Rt3UMHKC5evy]{Blink} as a 4th-level divine innate spell.

(Zombie, Shock) Lightning Rod.name: (Zombie, Shock) Lightning Rod
(Zombie, Shock) Lightning Rod.description:
Trigger A spell or ability with the electricity trait is used within 30 feet of the shock zombie

Effect The shock zombie attempts to counteract the spell or ability (counteract level 3, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+17 #Counteract]]{+17}), harmlessly redirecting the electricity into one of its electricity coils.

(Zombie) Ankle Biter.name: (Zombie) Ankle Biter
(Zombie) Ankle Biter.description: This zombie fights just as well on the ground as it does standing. While @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, the zombie isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}, it ignores the status penalty to its attack rolls, and it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}. The zombie can also move up to half its Speed when it Crawls.

(Zombie) Disgusting Pustules.name: (Zombie) Disgusting Pustules
(Zombie) Disgusting Pustules.description:
The zombie is covered in pustules that rupture when it takes any piercing damage or any critical hit.

In either case, adjacent creatures are hit with vile fluid, causing them to become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Disgusting Pustules] save.

(Zombie) Feast.name: (Zombie) Feast
(Zombie) Feast.description:
If the zombie is adjacent to a helpless or unconscious creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour, the zombie can feast upon its flesh to heal itself.

This restores an amount of Hit Points equal to the zombie's level. If the creature is alive, the zombie deals damage equal to its jaws, fist, or claw damage.

(Zombie) Infested Zombie.name: (Zombie) Infested Zombie
(Zombie) Infested Zombie.description: The zombie's flesh is infested with swarming vermin. When the zombie is hit with a critical hit or destroyed, the swarm is set free. Its initiative is immediately after the zombie's. If the swarm is 4 or more levels lower than the zombie, it isn't worth XP (and doesn't add its XP to the encounter budget).

(Zombie) Persistent Limbs.name: (Zombie) Persistent Limbs
(Zombie) Persistent Limbs.description: The first time the zombie is critically hit with a melee or ranged Strike, a limb falls off its body and continues to attack. The limb acts on the zombie's initiative; each round it can Stride up to half the zombie's Speed and make a Strike. The limb uses and contributes to the zombie's multiple attack penalty.

(Zombie) Plague-Ridden.name: (Zombie) Plague-Ridden
(Zombie) Plague-Ridden.description:
The zombie carries a plague that can create more of its own kind.

This functions as the @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.KxN9aGFGPxl6oLGF]{Plague Zombie's} zombie rot, except at stage 5, the victim rises as another of the zombie's type, rather than a plague zombie.

Zombie Rot

An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Zombie Rot]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day)

Stage 3 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as another of the zombie's type immediately

(Zombie) Putrid Stench.name: (Zombie) Putrid Stench
(Zombie) Putrid Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:15] @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The zombie's rotting flesh is particularly malodorous. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:] save. On a failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all zombies' putrid stenches for 1 minute.

(Zombie) Rotting Aura.name: (Zombie) Rotting Aura
(Zombie) Rotting Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} as its wounds fester. This damage increases by 1d6 for every 6 levels the zombie has.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.

(Zombie) Spitting Zombie.name: (Zombie) Spitting Zombie
(Zombie) Spitting Zombie.description: The zombie spits acid as a ranged Strike with a range of 30 feet. This uses the highest attack bonus among the zombie's Strikes and deals [[/r {1d12}[acid]]]{1d12 acid damage} per 3 levels of the zombie (or [[/r {1d6}[acid]]]{1d6 acid damage} below level 3). On a critical hit, the target also takes [[/r {1d4}[persistent,acid]]]{1d4} @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent acid Damage} per 3 levels of the zombie. Once used, the zombie must spend 1 action to cough up enough acid to use this ability again.

(Zombie) Tearing Grapple.name: (Zombie) Tearing Grapple
